title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) 

Regulations 2024.

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations “Council Regulation” means Council
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations “Council Regulation” means Council 
Regulation (EU) 2024/257 of 10 January 2024 as amended by Council 
Regulation (EU) 2024/1015 of 26 March 2024 and Council Regulation (EU) 
2024/1856 of 28 June 2024. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also 
used in these Regulations, has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same 
meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation council regulation mean council regulation (eu) 2024 257 10 january 2024 amended council regulation (eu) 2024 1015 26 march 2024 council regulation (eu) 2024 1856 28 june 2024 (2) word expression used council regulation also used regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation council regulation

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: 3. The master of -
text_raw:
3. The master of - 

(a) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

(b) 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Articles 7, 12a, 13, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 24, 27, 28, 30, 33, 
35, 36, 38, 39, 40, 41(2), 42, 45, 48, 48a, 48b, 48c and 55 of the Council 
Regulation.
text_norm: 3 master - (a) irish sea-fishing boat wherever may (b) sea-fishing boat exclusive fishery limit state shall comply article 7 12a 13 15 16 17 18 19 20 24 27 28 30 33 35 36 38 39 40 41(2) 42 45 48 48a 48b 48c 55 council regulation

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: 4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of -
text_raw:
4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the master of - 

(a) 

an Irish sea-fishing boat wherever it may be, or 

(b) 

a sea-fishing boat in the exclusive fishery limits of the State 

shall comply with Article 10(1), (2), (3) and (4) of the Council Regulation in 
relation to sea bass. 

(2) The master of an Irish sea-fishing boat operating in ICES Sub-area 6 or 
ICES Sub-area 7 is subject to the Bass (Conservation of Stocks) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 230 of 2006) in relation to sea bass. 

1 OJ L 2024/257, 11.01.2024. 
2 OJ L 2024/1015, 27.3.24. 
3 OJ L 2024/1856, 1.7.2024. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 13th September, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [457] 3 

(3) A person engaged in recreational fisheries that is fishing for sea bass shall 

comply with Article 10(5) of the Council Regulation.

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: 5. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 274 of 2023) are
text_raw:
5. The Sea-Fisheries (Quotas) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 274 of 2023) are 

revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

10 September, 2024. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [457]

title: (2) A word or expression that is used in the Council Regulation and is also
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations have the purpose of giving effect to the provisions of Council 
Regulation (EU) 2024/257 (as amended by Council Regulation (EU) 2024/1015 
of 26 March 2024 and Council Regulation 2024/1856 of 28 June 2024) fixing 
for 2024, 2025 and 2026 the fishing opportunities for certain fish stocks, 
applicable in Union waters and, for Union fishing vessels, in certain non-Union 
waters and amending Regulation (EU) 2023/194. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [457] 5
